DOC.brief_summary: Evaluation of the effectiveness of an individually educated exercise program for the lower back at home in employees over a period of 20 weeks. We hypothesize that regular exercise for the lower back results in greater improvements of low back strengths compared to controls.
DOC.criteria: men and women age between 18 and 67 years beeing currently involved in an exercise program for the lower back known drug or alcohol abuse any disease that excludes the participation in an exercise program clinical relevant acute or chronic infections pregnant women
